3/4 Besides feeling generally happy and thankful, my main feeling now is a slight regret that my research wasn't actually more directly useful. 

I hope I'm reminded of this feeling whenever I'm writing future grant applications - to aim for actual impact not just 'impact'

1086327936184070145.text: 2/4 Plus, it turns out international conferences are a breeze compared to standing in a room, justifying your research and findings to those people actually living the situation you are studying. It really brings you back from abstraction and publication-pushing to reality

1086327926495227904.text:
1/4 Currently in Tanzania saying thank you to all those who participated in my research and giving/receiving feedback. 

Probably the best, most useful and most rewarding thing I've done in my PhD. 

Really try and put it in your research budget, so valuable.pic.twitter.com/8lZplYPHO6
